creator.name: Agent-Generaal voor de Immigratie in Suriname
creator.name_english: Agent General for Immigration in Suriname
creator.his_func:
Even before the Emancipation on the 1st of July 1863, the government started a policy of promoting the arrival of Asian contract-workers to take over the work on the plantations.
Until 1864 the Inspector of the domain lands was charged with the surveillance of these immigrants; from 1864 to 1872 it was the responsibility of the Commissioner of the emancipated slaves in Paramaribo.
The function of Agent General for the Immigration (head of the Immigration Department) was established in March 1872. The Department was responsible for the registration of the new immigrants and for their allocation to the plantations. Personal data of the immigrants were noted in immigration registers. In the districts the District Commissioners kept control of immigration on behalf of the Agent General.
